column5: Has anyone here used this product yet and if so what did you think of it ? Does it compare to berkley gulp or is it better ? I have heard it is better then gulp but who knows !!! I like the look of the trigger x walleye minnow , could be good for lakers this soft water season. Thanks

I picked up the leach and something else for walleye last year. I use gulp and other plastics in the place of bait. Last year though I ended up on a troll bite and never broke out the trigger x or the gulp.
have a bunch of them, havent really put them to too much use yet. i personally dont find the gulp all that great either. both will work under the rite conditions.
I hated the texture.  They literally slide off the hooks in some applications.
gulp has worked a lot better for me. i bought 3 packages of trigger x last season and had very little luck with it.
Their senko style worm is too skinny to fit on my o rings.  They slide right though.  I just remembered I have a bunch of them and i meant to use them for ice fishing.  Thnaks for reminding me.
Got a few packs for christmas so i havent tried em yet.What works for me though, for LMB at least, is the 7" Gulp superworm in Tequilla Sunrise color, Texas rigged.
